JB wrote:

>  Jonathan Oddy wrote:
>  > 
>  > Not so much pain yet as worry.  In the context of my current
application I
>  > don't think there would (ever?) be much pain in this process - because
these
>  > objects (in the production code) can not come into existence any other
way,
>  > consequently their serialisation/deserialisation code is one of the
first
>  > things to be tested and is executed pretty thoroughly.  However in
other
>  > projects...

>  Almost every problem I have ever had with software has boiled down to 
>  /someone/, /somewhere/ saying, "That's OK. That'll /never/ happen."

Indeed, which was one of the reasons I asked the original question...  "It
works okay now, but should I/is there a better way of doing this?".  Your
helpful answer is (as I expected it to be) "Yes, and here's what it is..."

Thank you.  (Thread closed)
